byline.contributor: Artin Afkhami contributed reporting from Boston, Steven Lee Myers from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Pres Obama vows to push for 'toughest sanctions' against Iran, saying United States has strong evidence that Iranian officials were complicit in alleged plot to kill Saudi ambassador to US; seeks to counter skepticism about whether Iran's Islamic government directed an Iranian-American car salesman to engage with a Mexican drug cartel to kill Saudi ambassador, and carry out other attacks.
snippet: President Obama will push for what he calls the “toughest sanctions” to punish Iranian officials whom he accused of complicity in a suspected plot to kill the Saudi ambassador to the United States.
lead_paragraph: President Obama will push for what he calls the “toughest sanctions” to punish Iranian officials whom he accused of complicity in a suspected plot to kill the Saudi ambassador to the United States.

headline.main: Obama Says Facts Support Accusation of Iranian Plot
headline.print_headline: Obama Pledging Tough Sanctions For Iran In Plot
headline.seo: Obama Vows to Punish Iran in Alleged Plot Against Envoy
